page.title: 09FARMING (2)
page.content: HAY AND SILAGE ARE FED TO SHEEP AND CATTLE IN THE WINTER.COWS AND YOUNG LIVESTOCK ARE HOUSED FOR THE WINTER IN STRAW COVERED YARDS OR CUBICLES.EWES ARE BROUGHT IN FOR LAMBING AT CHRISTMAS AND RETURNED TO GRASS WHEN LAMBS ARE A FEW DAYS OLD.MOST LIVESTOCK ARE TURNED OUT TO GRASS BY MAY 1ST. EACH FARMER OWNS TRACTORS AND MACHINERY FOR PLANTING AND HARVESTING. BIG BALE SILAGE IS POPULAR AND IS DONE BY HIRED CONTRACTORS. MOST FARMS HAVE THEIR OWN SPRING WATER WHICH IS PUMPED BY ELECTRICAL PUMPS TO HOLDING TANKS FOR LIVESTOCK OR HOUSEHOLD USE.
